Betsy worked at Charles Schwab before you started

Join us next Thursday 10/16 from 9am-5pm PST for our 2nd Annual #NoTurkeyTalkathon Twitter Party! We'll be chatting about all things vegetarian for this year's Thanksgiving feast! #noturkey #vegetarian #thanksgiving2017

Last week we volunteered at The Redwood Empire Food Bank in Santa Rosa to support Northern California wildfire relief efforts. Together with Numi Organic Tea, Veritable Vegetable, Annie's Inc., Clif Bar & Company, and Berkeley Emergency Group, we packed 6,750 pounds of carrots and a total of 13,230 pounds of food to help feed those in need. Big thanks to In Good Company and everyone who volunteered their time! #secondresponders #californiawildfires

At Amy’s, we invest in getting it right. That’s why we sent a core team to SHRM's Diversity & Inclusion Conference in San Francisco. We think it’s important to empower our leaders with diversity skills and competencies in order to strengthen our teams and employees. #diversityandinclusion #workplaceeffectiveness
From our family to yours, happy Halloween!
Partner for a Better Pipeline: Facebook’s Story of Success With Year Up

*  Developed an Intranet Solutions 3 - 5 year strategy based on assessment of current environment, extensive research, future trends, stakeholder interviews, and discussions with outside consultants/industry peers. My focus was on reducing the complexity and cost of our applications, establish overall governance, and mitigate risks. The overall plan established 5 overarching themes; Governance & Risk Management, Simplify & Consolidate, Productivity & Mobility, Modernize & Innovate, Integrate & Personalize. *  Deliver technical guidance, oversight, approval of all changes to the SharePoint production environment; including enhancements, configuration changes, bug fixes and new requests.
SharePoint Solutions Architect and Technical Lead for Charles Schwab's enterprise intranet and  collaboration deployment of SharePoint platforms and technologies.

Tools Work Request (TWR) and other InfoPath development -Pioneered, designed, developed, and branded the Tools Work Request (TWR) to receive, route, and track all requests submitted to the Tool Support Team
eForms Development - Designed, developed, and administered the corporate electronic Forms hosted on the Schweb Solaris platform using HTML, JavaScript validation, CGI and Perl backend.
Sort & organize donated items, safety and hygiene kit assembly

March 29, 2016, fernando worked with Betsy in different groups

I have worked with Betsy Wallace for over 5 years at Levi Strauss and Company. Her professionalism and attention to detail has not only benefited our department, but the entire business as a whole. Betsy introduced end-user processes, procedures and new capabilities, some of which Levi Strauss and Company still uses today. As she wanted to grow into an architectural role she decided to leave the Levi family for other opportunities. Betsy is always willing to learn new technologies and is excited to learn new methodologies to achieve goals. Definitely an “think outside the box” individual. An asset to any organization!Thanks,Fernando PennesSr. Network EngineerLevi Strauss and Company

Michael Wangeman
Web Technologist
February 2, 2016, Betsy worked with Michael in the same group

Being a long term member of the Digital Workplace Group, I've collaborated with other firms internationally on the evolution of corporate intranets.  Currently, one of the most common platforms that corporations around the world use is Microsoft's SharePoint, due to its UGC (User Generated Content).  At Charles Schwab, Betsy Wallace began and has maintained the effort to lead and implement  Microsoft's SharePoint to replace its existing Content Management System,  Autonomy's Interwoven (which has become obsolete in ways).  With Betsy's never ending enthusiasm, she has evangelized SharePoint to all the major enterprises that rely on the intranet, i.e.  Brokerage Operations, Human Resources, Corporate Oversight, and all the other enterprises within Schwab.In addition, as Senior SharePoint Architect for the firm, Betsy was always aware of mitigating risks from Microsoft which helped the firm save money and undo risk .  Finally, I need to highlight the fact that Betsy lead the tedious effort with Microsoft in migrating SharePoint from version to version, going back to MS 2003 to MS 2007 to MS 2010.  Her efforts paid off in a seamless transition from year to year, which made the firm up to speed creating a current world class intranet.Any company would be lucky to have Betsy Wallace as a Senior SharePoint Architect.  She is a complete delight to work with and she has a strong  knowledge technologically of Microsoft's SharePoint.

summary: Comprehensive 15+ years of IT professional experience with proven ability to lead change and provide enterprise wide process enhancements and technology solutions. Strong strategic vision with a unique ability to translate business requirements to technical solutions. Extensive technical skills ranging from web technologies to application architecture. Strong leadership and team skills with the ability to develop sound working relationships with management, team members, peers, end-users, offshore, and third-party vendors.SharePoint solution and application architect experienced in systems analysis, architectural design, migrations and solutions implementation, project planning, project team management, developer supervision and management, standards and best practices development, enterprise application integration, and process re-engineering.*	Consistently selected by Senior Management for high-risk and high visibility projects*	Seen as the Subject Matter Expert for all SharePoint related questions
name: Betsy (Pierce, Clisham) Wallace
title: Communications & Collaborations Consultant at Amy's Kitchen
